top_categories.workout_context: Ned Gravel’s colorado rockies, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Ned Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Ned Gravel’s colorado mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Ned Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Ned Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ned Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Ned Gravel’s colorado mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Ned Gravel’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Every session at Ned Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Ned Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Ned Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on colorado mountain gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Ned Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Ned Gravel’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Ned Gravel with 6,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (8000+ feet).
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Ned Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: colorado rockies, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 75 miles of colorado mountain gravel in Nederland, Colorado.
